thread.title: Kenya Airways Seychelles Manager retires after 36 years
thread.title_full: Kenya Airways Seychelles Manager retires after 36 years

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Kenya Airways Seychelles Manager retires after 36 years
text:
Kenya Airways Seychelles Manager retires after 36 years   
Aug 26, 2015 eTN   
Zakiya Vidot, the Manager of Kenya Airways in Seychelles has retired after over 36 years of dedicated service. This week Zakiya Vidot met Alain St.Ange, the Seychelles Minister responsible for Tourism and Culture in the presence of Sherin Naiken, the CEO of the Seychelles Tourism Board at the Ministry’s ESPACE Offices. 
This meeting was the opportunity for Minister St.Ange to say thank you to Mrs Vidot on behalf of the Ministry of Tourism and Culture and on behalf of Seychelles for her dedication to the tourism industry. 
“You have been a solid member of our industry and we valued your support for Seychelles tourism. You and Kenya Airways have remained faithful partners of our industry and for this we are really grateful” said Minister Alain St.Ange to Zakiya Vidot in the presence of Sherin Naiken. 
The Tourism and Culture Minister wish Mrs Vidot a happy and enjoyable retirement and said that Seychelles is looking forward to the same level of cooperation with the new Senior Management of Kenya Airways Seychelles.
